Factors Influencing Aurora Borealis Visibility

One key factor influencing the visibility of the Northern Lights is solar activity. In the context of South Dakota, understanding how solar activity impacts the region is crucial for planning your Northern Lights experience.

Timing is everything when it comes to Aurora Borealis sightings. Unlocking the celestial calendar involves pinpointing periods of increased solar activity, often during solar maximum years. These peak times, occurring approximately every 11 years, promise heightened auroral displays, making it the prime time to witness the Northern Lights in all their glory.
